p: Various frameworks and strategies have been developed for understanding stakeholder engagement in research and its relationship with research utilization [ 23â€“ 25]. These involve a focus on engagement of community and governmental stakeholders throughout study design, implementation, interpretation of findings and dissemination, and utilization through development of recommendations or action plans, policy changes, and national programming changes [ 25]. To our knowledge, these strategies have not been applied to assess the utilization of studies of PSE among key populations. In response, this study aims to assess stakeholder engagement in PSE studies, and the uptake of PSE in HIV policy and program documents spanning the continent of Africa using adapted measures of research utilization and stakeholder engagement.
